# The `CallInst` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class represents a function call, abstracting a target machine&#39;s calling convention. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::CallInst</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class represents a function call, abstracting a target machine&#39;s calling convention.

This class uses low bit of the SubClassData field to indicate whether or not this is a tail call. The rest of the bits hold the calling convention of the call.

Definition at line 1479 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

### Create() {#a1f815573461be87717cbb7a4ce30f875}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>CallInst &#42; CallInst::Create (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">CallInst</a> &#42; CI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa97c65466bdd34abda6772dd32eb5d19">OperandBundleDef</a> &gt; Bundles, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/insertposition">InsertPosition</a> InsertPt=nullptr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a clone of <code>CI</code> with a different set of operand bundles and insert it before <code>InsertBefore</code>.

The returned call instruction is identical <code>CI</code> in every way except that the operand bundles for the new instruction are set to the operand bundles in <code>Bundles</code>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l01568">1568</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l00741">741</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
